comments.author: Raphael Park

comments.text:
Thor was originally a Warrior, as it made more sense with his lore. They 
changed it because his kit is more focused on damage, while warriors tend 
to have kits focusing on both good damage and defense. Note that he has the 
potential to be a Warrior, but his kit is generally focused around dealing 
damage, while most warriors have atleast one ability that increases healing 
or defense, giving them sustain.

He also has no natural sustain at all, since he burns through mana faster 
than pretty much any other god, and has crap MP5.
comments.author: matsczon

comments.text: +Sward Swil Its technically good, but not practical

comments.text:
+Simon Chiu its considered mobility in terms that you can go from on place

comments.author: Sward Swil

comments.text:
+Sward Swil Even though it has a very long range, I dont consider as a 
mobility tool, as its usually used to secure kills, or gank, rather than as 
an OH SHIT leap button.
comments.author: Rainpool

comments.text:
+Simon Chiu yeh i do agree that serqet is the most mobile right now. i 
think that thor has such high mobility in the chat mainly because of his 
ult. i mean it's not global range but its really big so you can go from one 
lane to the other lane jungle very fast .
comments.author: Sward Swil

comments.text:
+Feces .Canine Id say movement speed is also part of a gods mobility, but 
not too much of it. An example is Mercury, he has the highest movement due 
to his 2 passive, butt his only reliable escape is his 3 and 4, and both 
cant go through walls. However because of his insane movement speed, he can 
be classified as a highly mobile god. However IMO, the most mobile god is 
serqet, with the highest BASE movement speed if 380, and a one of the 
fastest dashes in game with only 10sec cooldown, and a long ranged jump, 
she is very slippery
comments.author: Rainpool

comments.text: Mobility = How easily/quickly you can get from point A to point B
comments.author: Feces .Canine

comments.text:
I actually disagree that thor has a LOT of mobility, as the chart shows 
that he has 5 points in that. Id say 3 or 4 would be more suitable.
comments.author: Rainpool

comments.text:
Mobility means how easy it is for him to move period. Which includes 
escaping, and chasing players down. His 1 and 4 are what I believe gives 
him that mobility.
comments.author: Xoct Sënuch

comments.text:
He has a lot of movement abilities, which he can use to escape or to 
engage. He also is more mobile because he's immune to knock-up. For 
example, if a Sylvanus ults, Thor can use his 3 to not get knocked-up
comments.author: João Santos

top_comment.author: To Sam Ja

comments.text:
Learn to listen his 3 and try to move yourself to a position that wouldn't 
make much sense, so he would never think of casting it there
Dodge his 1, as it makes him more likely to hit his ult or his 3
Don't use slows BEFORE he pops up his 2 as it will render them useless
Try to zig zag a lot when fighting him and if you have a leap/dash save it 
for when he uses his ult which is easy to hear

I'm only level 16 so rely on whatever you want, to decide if you're going 
to trust my advice or not
comments.author: League of Smitota 2

captions.text:
What's going on everybody my name is
Trendkill I've got my body back
that means it's time for another episode of
Know Your Enemy
Dramatic Wooooshhhh
Dramatic Intro Bum Bum Bum
Dont look behind you...
So if you couldn't tell we're going through the 3 gods first we've already discussed

a hunter, a guardian, and a mage. Today
we're gonna be talking about the free

assassin. This video is about Thor the God
of Thunder
Wooooshh

Okay so by now you guys probably
know, the first thing we do in each one

of these videos, is we take a brief look at
a visual representation of what each god
is good at
Now you can see,Thor has no healing. He can't heal himself

or his teammates, and he has extreme
mobility. He's one of the most mobile god's in

the game and we'll explain why here in a
little bit

but everything else is pretty much
spread very evenly, he's got these
control, damage, utility, and defense

again no healing, very high mobility. Now
assuming you've read his ability his kit

is pretty straightforward but we are
going to go through a few of the
highlights.

Remember that his passive gives him an 
innate physical power buff

that's one of the very few passives or the
very few things in the game

that's gonna give you just physical
power for free. So essentially in a fight

with three or more of Thor's enemies, you
can assume that he's approximately an
item ahead of you

physical damage wise, because he gets
that innate 45 physical power

just from his passive, so you wanna be
careful boxing a Thor in a teamfight.

Now beyond his passive also remember
that he can teleport to his hammer, Mjolnir's

anytime he throws it, this is what gives
him a ton of mobility so be wary of that

and lastly he is immune to knock up
while he's in his Berserker Barrage, his

third ability,other than that everything
else is extremely straightforward
Fancy Wooooshhh
Hi nerds <3

All right let's check out Thor's
mechanics, now Thor has more tips for him

than any of the other gods I've done
thus far.
So I'm going to do my best to keep this at a consistent kind of quick pace

while making sure that I don't leave out
any of the vital information so first things first

and this is really more of a tip for any
time you're playing the game in general
but specifically

if you're playing against a god like
Thor, who can ultimate up into the air
and come crashing down in any direction

you want to be able to watch him,so you can
see where he's headed and with the

restricted camera pitch that is on by
default you can't do that.

So to fix that what you want to do is
from the main menu, head up to your settings

which is in the top left hand corner, its the 
little blue gear, click that and go over to
the controls tab an then unclick

restricted camera pitch. That will allow you
to look around freely

you can look up to the sky, you can look down
at the ground, you can look at any
direction you want

instead of being restricted to just
basically looking straight ahead,

believe me Thor's ultimate is already
powerful enough in the mobility and the

ganking potential that it adds to his
kit,

you don't want to add more to that by not being
able to see where it's coming from.

Alright so lets get into the abilities, first
off let's talk about Mjolnir's Attunement

this is his first ability, it's the
hammer throw that he has.

Remember that the hammer throw can be
teleported to at anytime

whether it's going away from him or
coming back to him he can teleport to
that hammer.

This includes teleporting through walls,
so when you saw Thor's mobility off the
charts on the graph earlier

this is a big reason why. So a lot of
the times what you may see him do is
ultimate in to get a kill

and then use his teleport to quickly get
out of harm's way and that's how most

assassins should be played get in, get a kill, get
out. Another thing you want to remember is that

the hammer is like a boomerang and again
we've already discussed this but it goes
away from him and then comes back to him.

So remember if you get caught in that
boomerang and it hits you going away from him

and back to him it will deal triple
ability damage.

If we look at some quick math let's not
talk about protections or let's not talk
